dialogues.text: It's out of order. It's not working. MILO shoots at the fish tank. It smashes. Goldfish and water pour out. The safe is revealed.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're crazy. You're a maniac.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Open it.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I changed the combination. Yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I've forgotten. I can't remember.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Remember.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: It's the truth. I can't remember. MILO points the gun at ANDREW.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Remember.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: What are you doing? What are you going to do? MILO opens the gun, adjusts the chamber.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: I've broken into your house because I know you have jewels in your safe. Get me? I have inside information. I want them. MILO points the gun at ANDREW.  104 72. ANDREW ducks away sharply. MILO shoots. ANDREW screams, collapses onto the floor. He lies still. He slowly opens his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I'm still alive!

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: It was blank. But the next one is real. MILO stands over ANDREW. He kicks him.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Remember the combination and open the safe. ANDREW crawls to the safe and opens it, trembling and muttering.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Give me the jewels. ANDREW does so.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's a good boy. So what are you writing at the moment?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: What am I writing?

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm very interested in literature. I'ma kind of artistic thief.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Do you mind if I have a drink?

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Sure. It's your house. ANDREW walks into MAGGIE's dressing room.  73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANDREW pours himself a drink. The gun is still trained on him.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm always interested in the people I rob. Like I'm always interested in the husbands of the wives I fuck.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Are you really? Well well. Cheers.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: So what are you writing?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: A story about a pathological killer. I call it "The Smiling Man".

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Does he come to a bad end?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: He dies during the act of love, like countless others.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Countless others, eh? I can see you've researched the subject thoroughly.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: What subject?

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Death in orgasm.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Yes, it's a beautiful notion, isn't it? To die in the arms of your beloved. Can you imagine anything more poignant?

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: I can't, no. You're a married man yourself aren't you?  74. ANDREW . Oh, yes. Married ten years. It was love at first sight.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Very moving.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Yes. And we're still in love. We're like two peas in a pod.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Someone told me your wife has a lover.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: She has, yes.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Do you know him?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Never met. him. He's some kind of Italian. Called Tandouri or something.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: One of the Bombay Tandouris?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: You've got it. You know something? I've never met an artistic burglar before. Fascinating. What's your background?

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: You.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Irish. Connemara. Spanish descent. By way of Uganda. My grandparents were slaves. My mother was a dark eyed dusky beauty.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Were you breast fed?  75.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Oh, sure. Like a baby. Shall I tell you what I want you to do with these jewels?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Put this bracelet on your wrist. MILO hands him a bracelet. ANDREW looks at it and slowly slips it onto his wrist.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Put these earrings on your ears. MILO hands him a pair of earrings. ANDREW looks at the earrings.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They clip. Clip them. On your ears. ANDREW clips them on to his ears.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: God, you look so charming. Now, put this necklace round your neck. MILO hands him a necklace. ANDREW puts it round his neck but can't fix the clasp.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let me give you a hand. MILO goes behind ANDREW and lifts the necklace.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How do you want it? Like this? or do you want it shorter? He tightens the necklace.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How about this? He tightens the necklace.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Or even shorter. Like a halter. He tightens it round ANDREW's neck.  76.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: You're hurting me.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Am I hurting you?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Don't hurt me.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: You sensitive to pain?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: very.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: I wouldn't hurt you, sweetheart. You're too much fun.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Am I really? « MILO Yes. You're wicked. I like that. ANDREW glances into a small mirror.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: You know something? I don't think these earrings really suit me.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: You're right. Take them off. ANDREW takes them off.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I don't think the bracelet is quite my style either.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: But the necklace is nice.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I'm not totally sure. He takes off the bracelet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, you can play about with these jewels until the cows come home. They're yours. Do what you like with them.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: But I thought you'd just stolen them?

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: No, no. That was a game. Just a game. I thought it might amuse you.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Well, you're the wicked one aren't you? MILO. You remember what I said. You won the first set six love and I was three love up in the second. Well, now it's ‘one set all.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: But who's going to win the third set?

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Remains to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: You like games, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Some. Not all.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: But you like being in charge--of the game?

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Oh yes. Sure.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I like a man who knows how to take charge of things.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Do you?  78.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I do. Listen. You've met my wife I think?

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: I have met her, yes.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Did she tell you she had a husband?

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Yes, she said she had a husband.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: How did she describe him?

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Remote. Cold. Malevolent. Spiteful. Arrogant. Ruthless. Jealous. Paranoid. Criminal tendencies. Mentally unsound. «+ ANDREW That's me all right! You know something? I like your mind. It excites me.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Does it really?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I like the way you go about things.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: You mean you like my style?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I like your style. That's right. I like it very much. Look. I want to make you a proposition. I want to show you something.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: You'll like it. I know you will. Just along the corridor. Let me show it to you. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly) OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk along the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Can't you put that gun away?

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: God, you're so strong, you're so ruthless, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Yes. « ANDREW Any idea what my proposition is going to be?

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Are you excited?

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Let's say intricued.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I think it will excite you very much. He opens the door into the guest suite.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: This is the guest suite. Isn't it nice? Look at the view. 79. 106 107 MILO looks out of the window. ANDREW opens another door.  80.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is the private bathroom. As you see, there's a little bar - and there's the fridge. Chilean chardonnay is chilling in there at this very moment. This suite is uninhabited. It has no occupant. How would you like it?

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Yes. I think I've come to the conclusion that you're my sort of person,

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Am I now?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I told you, I like your mind. I find it exciting. I need intellectual excitement, intellectual stimulation.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: They don't grow on trees.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I'm a rich man. What would you like to do? I can subsidise anything you want. You can open an art gallery in the village. Or a bookshop. Or - of course - a little theatre. You're a wonderful actor. You could choose all the plays and play all the leading parts. But this would be your home. And this would be your bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: You're asking me to live here?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I'm asking you to stay with me. But, we'd also travel. Jamaica, the Swiss Alps. I bet you're a great skier. You could ski to your hearts content and swim in the blue Caribbean. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'd be waiting at our table with a scotch on the rocks for you or a glass of chilled Chilean chardonnay. The world would be your oyster.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: But what about Maggie?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Forget her. Leave her to rot. Stay with me. You're my sort of person.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: It's quite tempting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILO's cell phone rings. He puts his gun in the holster, takes the cell phone from his pocket and listens.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello. . He listens.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hi. He listens.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's going OK. He listens.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're still talking. But we're on the right track. It's all going OK. He listens.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't come down. That would be a mistake. It's all going fine. He listens.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I love you too. He listens.  82.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I am. I'm kissing you. He listens.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh yes. I can taste your mouth. She puts the phone down.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She's threatening to come down.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: What the hell dces she want?

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: She wants that divorce.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Listen. What do you think of my proposition? MILO stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do you think of my proposition?

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Well, I like the idea of Jamaica. But what about Barbados?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: And Barbados. And Antigua.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Yes, it's true. There are so many places I haven't been. Hollywood. St. Petersburg. The Cote D'Azur. Coney Island. Oh, and I hear there's a wonderful hotel in Scotland called Balmoral.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: That's where the Queen lives.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Ah. So bed and breakfast is out.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: It's on if you know the Queen.  83.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: I don't.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: But I do.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: That's fantastic!

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I’m serious. We could have great times together.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Venice? Disneyland?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Whatever you want. Whatever you want. Whoever you want. I'll introduce you te whoever you want.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Kissinger? Pinochet? Madonna? Mike Tyson?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Yes, I must say, that, as offers go, it's quite tempting. You're a naughty tempter, aren't you? (pause) I'm so glad you like my mind. Not many people like my mind. Quite a few people like my body but I can't think of anyone who likes my mind. That makes you unique. But then of course you know what they say. The mind is the body.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Is that what they say?

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Well, somebody said something like it once. Bullshit, of course. Anyway - perhaps I am your sort of person. Who knows? But you'd have to be very nice to me. For instance, just at this moment I need a drink.  84.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: You can get your own drink.

dialogues.speaker: MILO -
dialogues.text: No, darling. You get it for me and then I might be nice to you.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Nice to me?

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: That's what I said. Whisky please. ANDREW does not move.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can't deny that you might find me a congenial companion. I really can't deny it. I could be quite a witty companion. Would you like a witty companion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very much.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: I'm particularly witty in the morning. Would that suit you? Some people hate wit in the morning. What about you?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I love wit in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Over boiled eggs? Do you like eggs?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Boiled or scrambled? I'm a dab hand in the kitchen. But you'd have to be nice to me and give me a drink when I ask for it. ANDREW pours a glass of whiskey and gives it to him.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You see, you can be really sweet when you put your mind to it, can't you?  109 85. He drinks.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Cheers. Listen, I can see what you're saying. I can see why you're inviting me to live with you. I can see that you're lonely. You need looking after. It's obvious. You need someone who would cater for your every whim. Don't you?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILO's cell phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Hello. He listens. “

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Darling. He listens.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? What? He listens.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh is that so? Are you? He listens.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I see. Are you sure? He listens.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. I see. He listens.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I get it.  86. He listens.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I told you, I get it. I understand. OK. Yes sure. OK. He listens.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: OK. I'li tell him. He puts the phone down.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Tell him what? MILO grins.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: That she loves you.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Is that so? What else did she say?

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Nothing?

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Nothing. MILO and ANDREW stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Listen! For Christ's sake make up your mind! I'm offering you something special. Something really special. We can seal it with a handshake. And then she'll be nowhere. We cut her out. You understand? We cut her out of our lives. Don't let her dominate you. Be yourself. Be independent. Be free.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Like you?  87.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Yes, that's right. Be free. Like me . ANDREW's telephone rings. They both look at it. ANDREW do not move. It stops ringing.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: You know, I've always been attracted by rich and powerful men. Rich and powerful men make all the girls quiver like a jelly on a plate.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: But you're not a girl.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Yes, it tickles the old cobblers, money .

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Girls dorf't have cobblers.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: You'd be surprised.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: But you're not a girl.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Well I may have been once, back in the good old days.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Maybe the good old days are coming back?

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Who knows? Look. I'd really like to see your bed. I mean let me be quite clear - this looks a very nice bed indeed, but yours is bigger. Can I have another look at it?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Sure. MILO picks up ANDREW's remote control.  110 ge.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Is this how you do it? He presses it. A wall moves, revealing the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Miraculous! I could really get to like this. MILO walks towards the bed.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Of course this is the marriage bed, isn't it? Is this where she took your virginity? Is this where your wife deflowered you? Is this where you were deflowered? He sits on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's a lovely bed. So bouncy. He takes off the shoulder holster and puts it down on a side table. He lies down on the bed, rests his head on th pillow.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm so touched to be offered a place in your heart, in your life. I'm touched. He smiles at ANDREW. ANDREW stands still. MILO smiles at ANDREW. ANDREW slowly moves towards him. He strokes MILO's face, tentatively.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: You're beautiful. He continues to stroke MILO's face. MILO speaks very quietly.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Take your hand off me.  89. ANDREW stops stroking.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take your hand off me. MILO throws him off violently.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuck off! Go and fuck yourself you big pouff! MILO gets off the bed.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jesus. I come here as an innocent bystander, as a totally respectable person - a humble, part time hairdresser - and you try to corrupt me. You try to seduce me. You know what you are? You're a menace. Also, you're a cunt. They stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Well, now you really are charming.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: You know who's going to love this story?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: What story?

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: This one. This one.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Maggie.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Oh really? MILO walks slowly to ANDREW, stands close to him and look into his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Oh by the way, she asked me to tell you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What ?

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: She's coming back to you. She's on her way.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: She's coming back to me?

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Yes. That's what she told me. On the phone.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: But I don't want her.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Well you've got her. She's all yours. You're welcome to her. She loves your money, baby. That's the nub of it,

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: But I don't want her. MILO goes to the wardrobe and takes out the leather coat.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing with that coat?

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: I'm taking it. Tell Maggie I'll be in touch. I want to have a drink with her. I want to bring her up to date. MILO puts the coat over his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How do you like me in this coat? Do you fancy me? He goes to ANDREW and kisses him lightly on the mouth.

dialogues.speaker: MILO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Goodbye, darling. MILO goes to the door. ANDREW takes MILO's gun out of the holster.  111 112 113 114 gl.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. MILO turns.

dialogues.speaker: MILO
dialogues.text: Yes? What?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Goodbye darling. ANDREW shoots him. After a few moments ANDREW walks across the room and stan looking down at the dead body. He stares at the dead body. His face is ashen, dead. ANDREW remains still, staring down at MILO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car turning slowly into the drive. A woman's hand hanging out the widow, tapping the side of the car. The car approaches the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANDREW hears the car. He turns, looks out of the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car stops. A woman's legs swinging out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANDREW staring out of the window. THE END. 111 112 113 114
